paper_abstract: We present a neurobiologically-inspired stochastic cellular automaton whose state jumps with time between the attractors corresponding to a series of stored patterns. The jumping varies from regular to chaotic as the model parameters are modified. The resulting irregular behavior, which mimics the state of attention in which a system shows a great adaptability to changing stimulus, is a consequence in the model of short-time presynaptic noise which induces synaptic depression. We discuss results from both a mean-field analysis and Monte Carlo simulations. (c) 2006 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Chaotic hopping between attractors in neural networks
